definition: night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
night
variant of 夜[ye4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month

sentences.english: Overworking day and night left him low.
sentences.chinese: 夜以继日地超负荷工作使他极度虚弱。

sentences.english: So he kept on working with a digital computer day and night.
sentences.chinese: 于是他夜以继日地用一台数字计算机工作着。

sentences.english: I have many hard-working elves putting in lots of overtime throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 我有很多勤劳的精灵助手，他们夜以继日地加班工作。

sentences.english: Work on the project is going on day and night.
sentences.chinese: 工程正在夜以继日地进行。

sentences.english: E. g. : He played computer games for fun day and night in the summer vacation.
sentences.chinese: 寒假他夜以继日地玩电脑游戏寻觅忧子。

sentences.english: I worked day and night on my early websites, because I loved it.
sentences.chinese: 初涉网络之时，我夜以继日的工作，因为我喜欢。

sentences.english: Being a farmer is a hard life. You have to work all day and all night.
sentences.chinese: 农民的生活非常不容易，因为你必须夜以继日地工作。

sentences.english: We have been working around the clock to try and end the violence there.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在夜以继日地努力，试图结束那里的暴力。

sentences.english: Thus night and day I worked at the chain with huge fires and cruel hard strokes.
sentences.chinese: 于是，夜以继日，烈火重锤，打造着这条铁链。

sentences.english: Men of distinction ponder over good and evil day and night.
sentences.chinese: 夫贵者，夜以继日，思虑善否。

sentences.english: Two neighbors had been fighting each other for nigh on four decades.
sentences.chinese: 两个邻居夜以继日地斗气，斗了有40年。

sentences.english: Day and night we are watching over your welfare.
sentences.chinese: 夜以继日我们都在关注你们的福利。

sentences.english: They worked day and night so that they could build the bridge on time.
sentences.chinese: 他们夜以继日地工作，为了能按时修建起这座大桥。

definition: day and night/round-the-clock
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
to make nothing of hardships
to stay up through the night (idiom)
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to spare no effort
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
to rise early and sleep late (idiom); to work hard/to study diligently/to burn the candle at both ends
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
hardworking/industrious
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
untiring/unremitting/indefatigable
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
